Wiley & Sons, Inc</attrValue></attribute><attribute><attrName>DC_Description__c</attrName><attrType>text</attrType><attrValue>The company publishes scientific, technical, and medical works, including journals and reference works such as Current Protocols and Kirk-Othmer Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology. It also produces professional and nonfiction trade books and is a leading publisher of college textbooks. In 2001 the firm bought For Dummies publisher Hungry Minds. In addition to printed materials, John Wiley produces titles on CD-ROM and provides online access to some of its journal titles. The Wiley family owns about 70% of the company and controls some 49% of its voting power.

While business traditionally has been strongest in its scientific publications division (nearly 40% of sales), John Wiley has seen a marked upswing in its other divisions, partly because of increased online sales. The company's Wiley InterScience is a Web site that gives its journal subscribers online access to most of its periodical titles. It also offers online professional and education exam reviews and other interactive materials, as well as a new mobile wireless service.</attrValue></attribute><attribute><attrName>DC_Email__c</attrName><attrType>email</attrType><attrValue>ncard@wiley.com</attrValue></attribute><attribute><attrName>DC_Employees__c</attrName><attrType>integer</attrType><attrValue>3300</attrValue></attribute><attribute><attrName>DC_Phone__c</attrName><attrType>phone</attrType><attrValue>(790)
